title.native: ガンダムビルドファイターズ

description:
The story is set in the near future when GunPla Battles, competitions that pit Gundam plastic models against each other, have become popular worldwide in the "Second GunPla Boom." Sei Iori, a first-year middle-school student and the only son of a model shop owner, is talented at building GunPla, but inexperienced in the GunPla Battles. He encounters a mysterious boy named Reiji, who happens to be an accomplished Gundam Fighter. Together, they strive for the GunPla Battle world championships.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Super Robot
tags.description: Prominently features large robots often piloted by hot-blooded protagonists.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Real Robot
tags.description: Prominently features mechanical designs loosely influenced by real-world robotics.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Proxy Battle
tags.description: A proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

node.description:
[Website](http://www.yatate.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yatate_hajime) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/矢立肇) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hajime_Yatate)

Hajime Yatate is a collective pseudonym for [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/)'s staff.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/富野由悠季) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yoshiyuki_Tomino)

Yoshiyuki Tomino is an anime creator best known for creating the Gundam anime franchise.

Began his career in 1963 with [Osamu Tezuka](https://anilist.co/staff/96938/)'s company, [Mushi Production](https://anilist.co/studio/68/), scripting and directing episodes of the first Japanese anime television series, [Astro Boy](https://anilist.co/anime/2747/). He later became one of the most important members of the anime studio [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/), going on to direct numerous anime through the '70s, '80s and '90s. He is perhaps best known for his transformation of the "Super Robot" mecha anime genre into the "Real Robot" genre with 1979's [Mobile Suit Gundam](https://anilist.co/anime/80/), the first in the Gundam franchise.

Known for using numerous pseudonyms.

(Source: Wikipedia)

Yousuke Kuroda is a Japanese screenwriter. He is affiliated with Studio Orphee and serves as the inside director (board of directors member).

Kuroda is a prolific writer in the anime industry. Having authored and scripted numerous anime series. Including several original productions. Some of the most notable are Infinite Ryvius, Scryed, Please☆Teacher!, Mobile Suit Gundam 00, and Waiting in the Summer.

In 2003, he won the Individual Award at the 8th Animation Kobe event.
Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). Aspired to work in the industry after having seen [Laputa: Castle in the Sky](https://anilist.co/anime/513/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Sunma47) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/三間雅文)

One of the industry's most prolific sound directors, having worked on more than 300 productions.

After having graduated college, Mima joined Magic Capsule, a sound production company ran by his relative [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062/). In 1986, he debuted as a sound director on [MD Geist](https://anilist.co/anime/1285/MD-Geist/). He left Magic Capsule in 1996, and later joined Techno Sound. In 2004, he became the studio's representative director.

[Website](http://maeyamada.com/) | [Website 2](http://hyadain.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/HyadainMaeyamad)

Maeyamada graduated in 2007 from Kyoto University and started his musical career immediately afterwards.
A Japanese band who has explored the genre's of Alternative Rock, Rap-Rock, and Synth Pop.
[Website](http://www.airi-hightone.net/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/airi-hightone/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/airi_maruta)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/suzupin) | [Tumblr](https://suzupin.tumblr.com/)

Yasuda began drawing when he was 19 years old, after being inspired by [Range Murata](https://anilist.co/staff/98445/Range-Murata)'s pictures. As an illustrator he usually works with novels, providing the cover art and illustrations. He also makes logo designs for companies and games.  He also works on Range Murata's Robot, where he did the chapters: "Ebony & Ivory (Volume 1 & 2)" and "Minus R (Volume 4)"; despite having different names they are part of the same storyline.

Yousuke Kuroda is a Japanese screenwriter. He is affiliated with Studio Orphee and serves as the inside director (board of directors member).

Kuroda is a prolific writer in the anime industry. Having authored and scripted numerous anime series. Including several original productions. Some of the most notable are Infinite Ryvius, Scryed, Please☆Teacher!, Mobile Suit Gundam 00, and Waiting in the Summer.

In 2003, he won the Individual Award at the 8th Animation Kobe event.

**Height:** 145 cm (4'9")
**Nicknames:** Ao-chan (あおちゃん), Kodomo sensei (こども先生, lit. Child teacher)
__Agency:__ Aoni Production

[Website (Columbia)](https://columbia.jp/yukiaoi) | [Website (FlyingDog)](https://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/flyingdog/-/Artist/A023992.html) | [Profile (Aoni Pro)](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/yuki-aoi.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/staff_aoi/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aoiyuki_official/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aoi_Yūki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/悠木碧)

Aoi Yabusaki, better known by her stage name Aoi Yuuki, is a Japanese actress, voice actress and singer represented by Pro-Fit.

Yuuki entered the entertainment industry at the age of four. As a child, she acted in films and dramas. From 1999 to 2002, she made regular appearances on the variety shows Appare Sanma Dai-sensei and Yappari Sanma Dai-sensei which aired on Fuji TV. When she was in fifth grade, she made her debut as a voice actress as [Sakura](https://anilist.co/character/15429/) on [Kino's Journey](https://anilist.co/anime/486/).

In late 2006, she was affiliated with the theater company Central. After her admission to high school in August 2007, she joined the agency Breath, whilst changing her stage name to Aoi Yuuki. In 2008, she got her first major role in [Kure-nai](https://anilist.co/anime/3358/) as [Murasaki Kuhouin](https://anilist.co/character/10174/). In August of the same year, she moved to the agency Pro-Fit.

In October 2011, she won the Newtype award for best lead voice actress for her role as [Madoka Kaname](https://anilist.co/character/37832/) in [Puella Magi Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/). She was also awarded for Best Lead Actress in the 6th Seiyuu Awards for Madoka Kaname, [Victorique de Blois](https://anilist.co/character/20170/) and [Tooru Ichii](https://anilist.co/character/38904/).

In 2013, Yuuki and [Ayana Taketatsu](https://anilist.co/staff/101996/) formed the singing unit [petit milady](https://anilist.co/staff/116523).

**Non-anime voice roles:** 
- [Lumine](https://anilist.co/character/209682/Ying) - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Gwen Stacy - Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse (Movie); Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse (Movie)
- Renne Bright - Eiyuu Densetsu: Sen no Kiseki IV (VG), Eiyuu Densetsu: Hajimari no Kiseki (VG), Eiyuu Densetsu: Kuro no Kiseki (VG)
- Yurusen - Kamen Rider Ghost (VG)
- Fiona - Xenoblade Chronicles 3 (VG)
- Rita Rossweisse - Honkai Impact 3rd (VG)
- Moddey - Memento Mori (VG)
- Futaba Sakura - Persona 5/Royal (VG)
- Pascal - NieR: Automata (VG) (VG)
- Nian - Arknights (VG)
- Istina - Arknights (VG)
- Ravi & Apocalyptic Ravi - Epic 7 (VG)
- Schneider - Reverse: 1999 (VG)
- Lysithea - Fire Emblem: Three Houses (VG)
- Cinderella - Nikke: Goddess of Victory (VG)
- Sugar - Reverse Collapse: Code Name Bakery (VG)
Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). Aspired to work in the industry after having seen [Laputa: Castle in the Sky](https://anilist.co/anime/513/).
Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). Aspired to work in the industry after having seen [Laputa: Castle in the Sky](https://anilist.co/anime/513/).

__Alma Mater:__ Toyo University

__[Website](https://www.yukihayashi.net/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hayayu1231)__

__Introduction:__
Yuuki Hayashi is a Japanese composer and arranger affiliated with Legendoor, who used to be a rhythmic gymnast

__Biography:__
His history in music began in university when he started creating music pieces for rhythmic gymnasts as a hobby for 5000 yen a piece. When he started getting requests from other universities for his music, his interest in music producing grew. After graduation, he was taught music for 6 months by a rhythmic gymnastics music producer, and now, he handles music for various sports. He also arranges music for dance, athletic competitions, companies, independent movies and recently, TV dramas and anime.

(Source: MyAnimeList, edited)
